name: Dr. Ngan Le
bio: Dr. Le is the director of the Artificial Intelligence and Computer Vision Lab and an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science & Computer Engineering at the University of Arkansas. She was a research associate in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE) at Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) in 2018-2019. She received a Ph.D degree in ECE at CMU in 2018, ECE Master degree at CMU in 2015, CS Master Degree at the University of Science, Vietnam in 2009 and CS Bachelor degree at the University of Science, Vietnam in 2005.   Her current research interests focus on Image Understanding, Video Understanding, Computer Vision, Robotics, Artificial Intelligence (Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Reinforcement Learning), Biomedical Imaging, SingleCell-RNA.   Dr. Le is currently an Associate Editor of Elsevier Machine Learning with Applications, a Guest Editor of Scene Understanding in Autonomous (Frontier, a Guest Editor of Artificial intelligence in Biomedicine and Healthcare (MDPI), and a Program Chair of Asilomar 2022. She co-organized the Deep Reinforcement Learning Tutorial for Medical Imaging at MICCAI 2018, Medical Image Learning with Less Labels and Imperfect Data workshop at MICCAI 2019, 2020, 2021, Visual Detection, Recognition and Prediction at Altitude and Range at ICCV 2022. Dr. Le is instructor lead of the Google Machine Learning Bootcamp 2021.Her publications appear in the top-tier conferences including CVPR, MICCAI, ICCV, SPIE, IJCV, ICIP etc, and premier journals including IJCV, JESA, TIP, PR, JDSP, TIFS, etc. She has co-authored 75+ journals, conference papers, and book chapters, 9+ patents and inventions. She has served as a reviewer for 10+ top-tier conferences and journals, including TPAMI, AAAI, CVPR, NIPS, ICCV, ECCV, MICCAI, TIP, PR, TAI, IVC, etc

name: Khoa Vo
bio: Khoa Vo is a Postdoctoral Researcher at AICV Lab. His research research focuses on exploring visual perception and its connection to language, 3D vision, and robotic manipulation.

name: Marta Veganzones
bio: Marta Veganzones is a Research Professional I at the AICV Lab, where she works on applying artificial intelligence to the poultry industry, with an emphasis on computer vision–based solutions. She holds a Master of Science in Computer Science from the University of Arkansas, completed in Spring 2025, and a Bachelor of Science in Telematics Engineering from Universidad Carlos III de Madrid. Her background combines academic research and industry experience. At Capgemini, she worked as a Software Intern within the Digital Customer Experience (BPM Development) team, gaining hands-on experience in enterprise software development, workflow automation, and data-driven system design. In research settings, she has developed deep learning models, automated large-scale data annotation pipelines, and worked with computer vision, NLP, and machine learning techniques on real-world datasets.

details.heading: Research Interests
data: Applied Machine Learning in agriculture and industry
Automation of data annotation and preprocessing pipelines

name: Minh Tran
bio: Minh is a Ph.D. student in Computer Science at the University of Arkansas, advised by Ngan Le. Before starting his Ph.D., I was a research assistant at AIOZ AI, advised by Tuong Do and Anh Nguyen. His current works mainly explore deep learning algorithms for semantic and instance segmentation tasks in images and videos.

details.heading: Research Interests
data: Deep learning algorithms for visual perception tasks (object detection, segmentation, pose estimation, etc.)

name: Thinh Phan
bio: Thinh Phan is a Research Assitant at AICV lab. He received his B.S. degree in Electrical Engineering from Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology, Vietnam. He received his M.S. degree in Computer Science from Chonnam National University, South Korea.

name: Trong Thang Pham
bio: Trong Thang is a PhD candidate at the University of Arkansas, Fayetteville under the supervision of Dr. Ngan Le. During his PhD, he research understanding experts' eye movement limitations to develop AI systems that augment their capabilities, with a focus on medical. So far, He has contributed several papers to the medical field, published at top-tier venues including ICCV, ACM MM, WACV, ACCV, and journals such as Artificial Intelligence in Medicine and Image and Vision Computing. He used to work as a core R&D researcher at AIOZ Singapore, developing digital twin technologies including talking face generation and 3D human models for metaverse applications. His team at AIOZ published two papers at CVPRW and CVPR.

details.heading: Research Interests
data: Human behavioral limitations and how AI can augment human capabilities
Integration of computer vision, deep learning, and interpretable AI
Eye-tracking–based analysis of human attention and decision-making
Human–AI interaction in high-stakes decision environments
AI-assisted diagnostic decision-making in medical and cardiology settings
Proactive AI tools to support and optimize clinical workflows

name: Cuong Ngo
bio: Ngo Xuan Cuong is a Master’s student at the University of Arkansas, where he also works as a Research Assistant in the AICV Lab. His research focuses on computer vision and vision–language models, with particular interests in object counting and medical AI.

name: Taisei Hanyu
bio: Taisei Hanyu is a lab assistant at the AICV Lab. He is currently working toward the M.S. in Computer Science. Recently, he obtained his honors B.S. degree in Computer Science at the Department of Computer Science and Computer Engineering at the University of Arkansas, Fayetteville.

details.heading: Research Interests
data: Semantic segmentation models on very high-resolution remote sensing imagery

name: Mark Agnello Alexraj
bio: Mark is a lab assistant at the AICV Lab, working on machine learning–based weather prediction. His current research focuses on forecasting fog conditions in Northwest Arkansas using data from NWA Airport, with the broader goal of improving model accuracy across multiple weather types.

name: Hao Vo
bio: Hao Vo is a Research Assistant at the AICV Lab, specializing in multi-camera tracking and video understanding. His expertise includes advanced computer vision methodologies, multi-modal video analytics, and their practical deployment in real-world environments.

name: Farid Hashemian
bio: Farid Hashemian is a master’s student whose research focuses on machine learning and statistical methods for complex, high-dimensional data. His work emphasizes scalable algorithms and robust representations for incomplete and uncertain data, with the goal of improving predictive reliability and generalization through optimization-based approaches.

name: Annie Prasanna Manoharan
bio: Annie Prasanna is a Research Assistant at the AICV Lab and started her Master’s in Computer Engineering in Fall 2024.

name: Ethan Coffman
bio: Ethan is an undergraduate research assistant at the AICV lab. He currently assists with research related to computer vision and thermal imaging. Ethan is also a member of the honor’s college at the University of Arkansas and currently is a part of the undergraduate research experience.

name: Kashu Yamazaki
bio: Kashu received a M.S. degree in computer science from the University of Arkansas, Fayetteville, in 2023. Previously, he received a B.S. degree with summa cum laude in mechanical engineering from the University of Arkansas, Fayetteville, in 2020. His research interests are vision-language models and robotics. He has authored publications appearing in international conferences and journals. He is a member of Tau Beta Pi.

name: Adrian de Luis
bio: Adrian de Luis was a Research Assistant at the AICV Lab. He started his Master’s of Science in Computer Science in January 2022 after working at GMV for around 3 years. He was part of the team which developed the Precise Positioning algorithm included in the next generation of vehicles for the BMW group at the time. Before his time at GMV, he graduated from the Bachelor’s of Science at the Universidad Carlos III in Telecommunication Technologies Engineering.

details.heading: Research Interests
data: Remote Sensing focused on aerial imagery

details.heading: Research Interests
data: Remote Sensing focused on aerial imagery

name: Malachi Massey
bio: Malachi Massey was a Research Assistant in the AICV lab. He worked on aerial Solar PV image analysis with Esteban Duran Marti. He has internship experience in the solar industry.

name: Esteban Duran Marti
bio: Esteban Duran Marti was a Research Assistant at the AICV Lab. He finished his Master’s in Operations Management on Spring 2025. He obtained Advanced Air Mobility Autonomous Operations MicroCertificate and a certificate in Project Management. He has experience creating mobile application, working on various startup companies and JB Hunt.

name: Phillip Cannon
years: Masters Graduate Dec 2025 - CTO at LexMed

name: Frederick Bumgarner
bio: Frederick Bumgarner was a lab assistant at the AICV Lab. He was working under Khoa Voho on research into 3D object tracking and analysis.

name: Yuki Ikebe
bio: Yuki Ikebe is a Research Assistant at the AICV Lab. His research focuses on super-resolution in remote sensing.

name: Johnmark Clements
bio: Johnmarck is a senior student in the computer science department at the University of Arkansas. For the past two years he has been working as a research assistant with Minh Tran on a virtual try-on project.

name: Bryan Williams
bio: Bryan is a senior Computer Science major in the honors college with a strong interest in pursuing a career in machine learning. My research focuses on video-based action recognition using multi-camera data. For my honors thesis, I plan to built an end-to-end deep learning pipeline for long-horizon action recognition and evaluated multiple spatiotemporal model architectures.

name: Gladys Gawugah
bio: Gladys is a master’s student in the Computer Science Department. Her research interests include computer vision, with a focus on small object detection, occlusion-aware learning, and image segmentation to improve performance in challenging real-world visual environments.

name: Sreevenkata Anjani Tishita Godavarthi
bio: Sreevenkata is a Computer Science graduate student currently pursuing her master’s degree at the University of Arkansas and a member of the AICV Lab. Her research interests include machine learning, deep learning, and computer vision, with experience in crowd analysis, and object detection. She has worked on research-oriented projects involving real-world datasets, focusing on scalable and practical computing solutions.

name: Phu Loc Nguyen
bio: Phu Loc Nguyen is a Research Assistant at the AICV Lab, University of Arkansas. He received his Bachelor’s degree in Artificial Intelligence from VNU University of Engineering and Technology, Vietnam. He is currently pursuing his M.Sc. degree at the University of Arkansas. His research interests lie in medical image analysis, deep learning–based segmentation, computer vision, and multimodal learning.
